sentences.en: By the 80 s, punk rock had really had its heyday.
sentences.cn: 到了20世纪80年代, 朋克摇滚乐已经到了全盛时期.

sentences.en: By the 80s, punk rock had really had its heyday.
sentences.cn: 到了20世纪80年代，朋克摇滚乐已经到了全盛时期。

sentences.en: During its heyday, 50,000 people passed through it every day.
sentences.cn: 在其鼎盛时期, 每天有五万人通过渡口.

sentences.en: GE Capital in its heyday about 50 % of the company's revenue.
sentences.cn: GE金融业务在鼎盛时期,其收入占到公司的50%.

sentences.en: In his heyday, he was a great tennis player.
sentences.cn: 他年轻力壮时, 是一位了不起的网球运动员.

sentences.en: In its heyday , the company ran trains every fifteen minutes.
sentences.cn: 公司在最兴隆时期每隔十五分钟就开出一列火车。

sentences.en: In its heyday, the studio's boast was that it had more stars than there are in heaven.
sentences.cn: 在其全盛时期，该制片公司夸口说，他们旗下的明星比天上的星星还要多。

sentences.en: In their heyday, the big firms dominated their markets.
sentences.cn: 诸多大公司在其鼎盛时期主导着各自的市场.

sentences.en: She was a great singer in her heyday.
sentences.cn: 她在自己的黄金时代是个了不起的歌唱家.

sentences.en: Steam railways had their heyday in the 19 th century.
sentences.cn: 19世纪是蒸汽机车的全盛时期.

sentences.en: The 19 th century was the heyday of steam railways.
sentences.cn: 19世纪是蒸汽机车鼎盛的时代.

sentences.en: The basketball team have have a heyday this season.
sentences.cn: 这支篮球队这一时期处于顶峰阶段.

sentences.en: The cover features a photo of the artists in their heyday.
sentences.cn: 封面是一张他们鼎盛时期的照片.

sentences.en: The development the arts may be called at the time its heyday.
sentences.cn: 这一艺术的发展在当时可称之为鼎盛时期.

sentences.en: Their heyday lasted from the late 19 th to the mid - 20 th century.
sentences.cn: 全盛期由19世纪后期延续到20世纪 中期.

trans.tran_en: the time when someone or something was most popular, successful, or powerful
